body.p: Which part of the neuron has plasma membrane proteins that will initiate an action potential a long distance away toward its target, if the signal reaches a strong enough level called the threshold?

response.feedback: Correct. The axon hillock will initiate an action potential that travels away from cell body if threshold is reached.
Incorrect. This connects to and sends the electrical signals to this area.
Incorrect. This is sending electrical signals to the cell body.

part.hint: This is a funnel-shaped part of the cell where one part of the neuron connects to another part.

body.p: Which part of the neuron has plasma membrane proteins that convert stimuli to electrical potential?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This sends electrical stimuli away from cell body.
Incorrect. This connects to and receives the electrical signals from this area.
Correct. This acts as the receptor for the cell, responding to some chemical or other stimuli and sending resulting electrical signal toward cell body.

part.hint: It is the part with increased surface area to allow better reception of this chemical message.

body.p: Which part of the neuron converts electrical potential to chemical stimuli for other neurons or target effector?

response.feedback: Correct. At the axon synaptic terminal vesicles will release a chemical messenger across synapse in response to action potential reaching the axon terminal.
Incorrect. This would not be at the “end” of the sequence along one neuron.
Incorrect. This would be at the “beginning” of the sequence along one neuron.

part.hint: This would happen at the “end” of the neuron that communicates with another neuron or its target across a space.

body.p: Which part of the neuron has most of the typical cellular organelles and the nucleus?

response.feedback: Incorrect. While sometimes very long, this part is relatively thin and specialized for propagating the action potential away from this part of the cell.
Correct. Even though it can receive input directly from other neurons, the cell body functions for cell metabolism and integration of signals for propagation if threshold is reached.
Incorrect. While this part can have a lot of surface area, this part is specialized for propagating the electrical signal toward this part of the cell.

part.hint: All parts have cytoplasm and some organelles, and material can move around within the cytoplasm, but one area has the nucleus and carries out majority of cellular metabolism.
